result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Leurquin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber, standard release.
Consecutive to: 21CM1146

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. RESTITUTION PAID IN FULL. Paid to Woodman's.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA. PAID IN FULL.
Remaining bail of $139.18 was applied to Court Costs. Balance of $113.82 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:03 PM Defendant Michelle L Leurquin in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called for plea and sentencing.
State is in compliance with victim's rights.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

In case 19CM1996:
 Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

In case 21CM1146:
 Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

In case 22CM639:
 Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Cases 19CM158, 21CM1149, and 21CM1855 are Dismissed and read in. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

The Court ordered the following: 
In case 19CM1996:
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL: 4 MONTHS in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-time.
TBD  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  2 YEARS; 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

RESTITUTION:  $96.37 to Walmart (Restitution to be paid before costs or fines); 
COSTS:  $243
DR GOD SURCHARGE: $10
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
*****************************************
In case 21CM1146:
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  4 MONTHS in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions). Consecutive to sentence in 19CM1996.
TBD  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  2 YEARS; 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
******************************************
In case 22CM639: 
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  4 MONTHS in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions). Consecutive to sentence in 21CM1146.
TBD  Days Credit.

*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Defendant consents to bail posted on dismissed and read in cases 19CM158, 21CM1149, 21CM1855 to be applied to financial obligations on cases 19CM1996, 21CM1146, and 22CM639.

Defendant to have no contact with Woodman's listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

08:35 AM Defendant Michelle L Leurquin appeared by Zoom with attorney Sarah A Ponath.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court swears in the Defendant. The Court extends the appointment of attorney Sarah Ponath to this case.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Attorney Ponath will assist with the signing of the signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Check Case scheduled for May 6, 2022.

Request for defendant to appear by zoom.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 04-27-2022. Granted.
